mpls-admin-group-config.description: configuration data for MPLS link admin groups

bit-position.description:
bit-position value for mpls admin-group. The value
for the admin group is an integer that represents one
of the bit positions in the admin-group bitmask. Values
between 0 and 31 are interpreted as the original limit
of 32 admin groups. Values >=32 are interpreted as
extended admin group values as per RFC7308.

mpls-admin-groups-top.description:
top-level mpls admin-groups config
and state containers

mpls-admin-groups.description:
Top-level container for admin-groups configuration
and state

admin-group.description:
configuration of value to name mapping
for mpls affinities/admin-groups

config.description: Configurable items for admin-groups

state.description: Operational state for admin-groups

mpls-te-igp-flooding-bandwidth-config.description:
Configurable items for igp flooding bandwidth
threshold configuration.

threshold-type.description:
The type of threshold that should be used to specify the
values at which bandwidth is flooded. DELTA indicates that
the local system should flood IGP updates when a change in
reserved bandwidth >= the specified delta occurs on the
interface. Where THRESHOLD_CROSSED is specified, the local
system should trigger an update (and hence flood) the
reserved bandwidth when the reserved bandwidth changes such
that it crosses, or becomes equal to one of the threshold
values

delta-percentage.description:
The percentage of the maximum-reservable-bandwidth
considered as the delta that results in an IGP update
being flooded

threshold-specification.description:
This value specifies whether a single set of threshold
values should be used for both increasing and decreasing
bandwidth when determining whether to trigger updated
bandwidth values to be flooded in the IGP TE extensions.
MIRRORED-UP-DOWN indicates that a single value (or set of
values) should be used for both increasing and decreasing
values, where SEPARATE-UP-DOWN specifies that the increasing
and decreasing values will be separately specified

items.description:
The thresholds (expressed as a percentage of the maximum
reservable bandwidth) at which bandwidth updates are to be
triggered when the bandwidth is increasing.

The thresholds (expressed as a percentage of the maximum
reservable bandwidth) at which bandwidth updates are to be
triggered when the bandwidth is decreasing.

The thresholds (expressed as a percentage of the maximum
reservable bandwidth of the interface) at which bandwidth
updates are flooded - used both when the bandwidth is
increasing and decreasing

mpls-te-igp-flooding-bandwidth.description:
Top level group for traffic engineering
database flooding options

igp-flooding-bandwidth.description:
Interface bandwidth change percentages
that trigger update events into the IGP traffic
engineering database (TED)

config.description:
Configuration parameters for TED
update threshold

state.description: State parameters for TED update threshold

te-lsp-delay-config.description:
Group for the timers goerning the delay
in installation and cleanup of TE LSPs

install-delay.description:
delay the use of newly installed te lsp for a
specified amount of time.

cleanup-delay.description:
delay the removal of old te lsp for a specified
amount of time

te-interface-attributes-top.description:
Top level grouping for attributes
for TE interfaces.

interface-id.description: Reference to the interface id list key

config.description: Configuration parameters related to TE interfaces:

state.description: State parameters related to TE interfaces

te-interface-attributes-config.description:
global level definitions for interfaces
on which TE is run

te-metric.description: TE specific metric for the link

items.description:
list of references to named shared risk link groups that the
interface belongs to.
list of admin groups (by name) on the interface

te-lsp-timers.description:
Definition for delays associated with setup
and cleanup of TE LSPs

config.description:
Configuration parameters related
to timers for TE LSPs

state.description: State related to timers for TE LSPs

mpls-global-config.description: Definition of global MPLS configuration parameters

null-label.description: The null-label type used, implicit or explicit

ttl-propagation.description:
Enables TTL propagation across the MPLS domain.
When ttl-propagation is set to true, the IP TTL
is copied into the MPLS header TTL when pushing
a label to an IP packet. If false, the IP TTL is
not copied into the MPLS header TTL and, therefore,
the IP TTL is not updated in the MPLS domain.

pw-encapsulation.description: The PDU type to use with pseudowires.

mpls-global-top.description: Top level grouping for global MPLS configuration

config.description: Top level global MPLS configuration

state.description: Top level global MPLS state

mpls-interfaces-top.description:
Top level grouping for attributes
for MPLS-enabled interfaces.

interface-id.description: Reference to the interface id list key

config.description: Configuration parameters related to MPLS interfaces:

state.description: State parameters related to TE interfaces

mpls-interface-attributes-config.description:
global level definitions for interfaces
on which MPLS is run

mpls-enabled.description: Enable MPLS forwarding on this interface

mpls-label-block-config.description: Configuration parameters relating to an MPLS label block.

local-id.description: A local identifier for the global label block allocation.

lower-bound.description:
Lower bound of the global label block. The block is defined to include
this label.

upper-bound.description:
Upper bound for the global label block. The block is defined to include
this label.

mpls-label-blocks-top.description:
Top-level configuration and operational state parameters corresponding
to reserved label blocks.

reserved-label-blocks.description:
A range of labels starting with the start-label and up-to and including
the end label that should be allocated as reserved. These labels should
not be utilised by any dynamic label allocation on the local system unless
the allocating protocol is explicitly configured to specify that
allocation of labels should be out of the label block specified.

reserved-label-block.description:
A range of labels starting with the start-label up to and including
the end label that should be allocated for use by a specific protocol.

local-id.description: A reference to a unique local identifier for this label block.

config.description: Configuration parameters relating to the label block.

state.description: State parameters relating to the label block.

mpls-top.description: Top level grouping for MPLS configuration and state

mpls.description:
Anchor point for mpls configuration and operational
data

global.description:
general mpls configuration applicable to any
type of LSP and signaling protocol - label ranges,
entropy label supportmay be added here

te-interface-attributes.description:
traffic engineering attributes specific
for interfaces

constrained-path.description:
traffic-engineered LSPs supporting different
path computation and signaling methods

unconstrained-path.description:
LSPs that use the IGP-determined path, i.e., non
traffic-engineered, or non constrained-path

static-lsps.description:
statically configured LSPs, without dynamic
signaling

reoptimize-timer.description:
frequency of reoptimization of
a traffic engineered LSP

enabled.description:
enables mpls auto-bandwidth on the
lsp

min-bw.description:
set the minimum bandwidth in Kbps for an
auto-bandwidth LSP

max-bw.description:
set the maximum bandwidth in Kbps for an
auto-bandwidth LSP

adjust-interval.description:
time in seconds between adjustments to
LSP bandwidth

adjust-threshold.description:
percentage difference between the LSP's
specified bandwidth and its current bandwidth
allocation -- if the difference is greater than the
specified percentage, auto-bandwidth adjustment is
triggered

te-lsp-auto-bandwidth-state.description: Operational state parameters relating to auto-bandwidth

interval-high-bw.description:
The maximum measured bandwidth during the current
auto-bandwidth adjust interval expressed in kilobits
per second.

te-lsp-overflow-config.description:
configuration for mpls lsp bandwidth
overflow adjustment

enabled.description:
enables mpls lsp bandwidth overflow
adjustment on the lsp

overflow-threshold.description:
bandwidth percentage change to trigger
an overflow event

trigger-event-count.description:
number of consecutive overflow sample
events needed to trigger an overflow adjustment

te-lsp-underflow-config.description:
configuration for mpls lsp bandwidth
underflow adjustment

enabled.description:
enables bandwidth underflow
adjustment on the lsp

underflow-threshold.description:
bandwidth percentage change to trigger
and underflow event

trigger-event-count.description:
number of consecutive underflow sample
events needed to trigger an underflow adjustment

items.description:
list of references to named admin-groups to exclude in
path calculation.

list of references to named admin-groups of which all must
be included

list of references to named admin-groups of which one must
be included

te-path-placement-constraints-state.description: Operational state data for link affinities

admin-groups.description:
Top-level container for include/exclude constraints for
link affinities

config.description: Configuration data

state.description: Operational state data

te-tunnel-protection-config.description:
Configuration parameters related to LSP
protection

protection-style-requested.description:
style of mpls frr protection desired: can be
link, link-node or unprotected.

address.description: router hop for the LSP path

index.description:
Index of this explicit route object to express
the order of hops in the path

named-explicit-path-config.description:
Configuration parameters relating to a named
explicit path

name.description:
A string name that uniquely identifies an explicit
path

explicit-paths-top.description:
Top level global explicit path configuration
grouping

named-explicit-paths.description: Enclosing container for the named explicit paths

name.description:
A string name that uniquely identifies
an explicit path

config.description:
Configuration parameters relating to named explicit
paths

state.description:
Operational state parameters relating to the named
explicit paths

index.description:
Index of this explicit route object,
to express the order of hops in path

config.description:
Configuration parameters relating to an explicit
route

state.description: State parameters relating to an explicit route

mpls-te-srlg-config.description:
Configuration of various attributes associated
with the SRLG

cost.description:
The cost of the SRLG to the computation
algorithm

flooding-type.description:
The type of SRLG, either flooded in the IGP or
statically configured

mpls-te-srlg-members-config.description: Configuration of the membership of the SRLG

from-address.description: IP address of the a-side of the SRLG link

to-address.description: IP address of the z-side of the SRLG link

mpls-te-srlg-top.description:
Top level grouping for MPLS shared
risk link groups.

srlg.description: List of shared risk link groups

config.description: Configuration parameters related to the SRLG

state.description: State parameters related to the SRLG

static-srlg-members.description: SRLG members for static (not flooded) SRLGs

members-list.description:
List of SRLG members, which are expressed
as IP address endpoints of links contained in the
SRLG

from-address.description: The from address of the link in the SRLG

config.description:
Configuration parameters relating to the
SRLG members

state.description:
State parameters relating to the SRLG
members

te-global-tunnel-config.description:
Configuration parameters relevant to a single
traffic engineered tunnel.

signaling-protocol.description: Signaling protocol used to set up this tunnel

description.description: optional text description for the tunnel

preference.description:
Specifies a preference for this tunnel.
A lower number signifies a better preference

metric-type.description:
The type of metric specification that should be used to set
the LSP(s) metric

metric.description:
The value of the metric that should be specified. The value
supplied in this leaf is used in conjunction with the metric
type to determine the value of the metric used by the system.
Where the metric-type is set to LSP_METRIC_ABSOLUTE - the
value of this leaf is used directly; where it is set to
LSP_METRIC_RELATIVE, the relevant (positive or negative)
offset is used to formulate the metric; where metric-type
is LSP_METRIC_INHERITED, the value of this leaf is not
utilised

shortcut-eligible.description:
Whether this LSP is considered to be eligible for us as a
shortcut in the IGP. In the case that this leaf is set to
true, the IGP SPF calculation uses the metric specified to
determine whether traffic should be carried over this LSP

protection-style-requested.description:
style of mpls frr protection desired: can be
link, link-node or unprotected.

p2p-path-state.description: Operational state parameters for p2p paths

items.description:
If the signalling protocol specified for this path is
RSVP-TE, this leaf-list provides a reference to the associated
sessions within the RSVP-TE protocol sessions list, such
that details of the signaling can be retrieved. More than
one session may exist during re-signalling such as
make-before-break.

spf-metric.description:
The IGP metric of the shortest path to the LSP destination.
This value is used to compare the current metric of the
constrained path to the shortest path that is available in
the network topology.

cspf-metric.description:
The IGP metric of the path currently used by the LSP.
This value is used to represent the metric of the path
used by the LSP following the execution of the CSPF
algorithm and signalling of the LSP.

path-computation-method.description:
The method used for computing the path, either
locally computed, queried from a server or not
computed at all (explicitly configured).

use-cspf.description: Flag to enable CSPF for locally computed LSPs

cspf-tiebreaker.description:
Determine the tie-breaking method to choose between
equally desirable paths during CSFP computation

path-computation-server.description:
Address of the external path computation
server

preference.description:
Specifies a preference for this path. The lower the
number higher the preference

te-tunnel-p2p-top.description: Top level grouping for p2p configuration

p2p-tunnel-attributes.description: Parameters related to LSPs of type P2P

config.description: Configuration parameters for P2P LSPs

state.description: State parameters for P2P LSPs

te-tunnel-state.description:
Counters and statistical data relevent to a single
tunnel.

oper-status.description: The operational status of the TE tunnel

role.description:
The lsp role at the current node, whether it is headend,
transit or tailend.

auto-generated.description:
If the LSP was auto-generated by the system this leaf
should be set to true. Examples of auto-generated LSPs
are dynamically created backup LSPs to meet a FRR
policy.

counters.description:
State data for MPLS label switched paths. This state
data is specific to a single label switched path.

bytes.description:
Number of bytes that have been forwarded over the
label switched path.

packets.description:
Number of pacets that have been forwarded over the
label switched path.

path-changes.description: Number of path changes for the label switched path

state-changes.description: Number of state changes for the label switched path

online-time.description:
Indication of the time the label switched path
transitioned to an Oper Up or in-service state.

The value is the timestamp in nanoseconds relative to
the Unix Epoch (Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

current-path-time.description:
Indicates the time the LSP switched onto its
current path. The value is reset upon a LSP path
change.

The value is the timestamp in nanoseconds relative to
the Unix Epoch (Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

next-reoptimization-time.description:
Indicates the next scheduled time the LSP
will be reoptimized.

The value is the timestamp in nanoseconds relative to
the Unix Epoch (Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

te-tunnel-bandwidth-config.description: Configuration parameters related to bandwidth for a tunnel

specification-type.description:
The method used for settign the bandwidth, either explicitly
specified or configured

set-bandwidth.description:
set bandwidth explicitly, e.g., using
offline calculation

te-tunnel-bandwidth-state.description: Operational state parameters relating to bandwidth for a tunnel

signaled-bandwidth.description:
The currently signaled bandwidth of the LSP. In the case where
the bandwidth is specified explicitly, then this will match the
value of the set-bandwidth leaf; in cases where the bandwidth is
dynamically computed by the system, the current value of the
bandwidth should be reflected.

te-tunnel-bandwidth-top.description: Top level grouping for specifying bandwidth for a tunnel

config.description:
Configuration parameters related to bandwidth on TE
tunnels:

state.description:
State parameters related to bandwidth
configuration of TE tunnels

config.description:
Configuration parameters relating to MPLS
auto-bandwidth on the tunnel.

state.description:
State parameters relating to MPLS
auto-bandwidth on the tunnel.

overflow.description:
configuration of MPLS overflow bandwidth
adjustement for the LSP

config.description:
Config information for MPLS overflow bandwidth
adjustment

state.description:
Config information for MPLS overflow bandwidth
adjustment

underflow.description:
configuration of MPLS underflow bandwidth
adjustement for the LSP

config.description:
Config information for MPLS underflow bandwidth
adjustment

state.description:
State information for MPLS underflow bandwidth
adjustment

p2p-path-candidate-secondary-path-config.description:
Configuration parameters relating to a secondary path which
is a candidate for a particular primary path

secondary-path.description:
A reference to the secondary path that should be utilised
when the containing primary path option is in use

priority.description:
The priority of the specified secondary path option. Higher
priority options are less preferable - such that a secondary
path reference with a priority of 0 is the most preferred

p2p-path-candidate-secondary-path-state.description:
Operational state parameters relating to a secondary path
which is a candidate for a particular primary path

active.description:
Indicates the current active path option that has
been selected of the candidate secondary paths

p2p-primary-paths-top.description: Top level grouping for p2p primary paths

p2p-primary-path.description: Primary paths associated with the LSP
List of p2p primary paths for a tunnel

config.description: Configuration parameters related to paths

state.description: State parameters related to paths

candidate-secondary-paths.description:
The set of candidate secondary paths which may be used
for this primary path. When secondary paths are specified
in the list the path of the secondary LSP in use must be
restricted to those path options referenced. The
priority of the secondary paths is specified within the
list. Higher priority values are less preferred - that is
to say that a path with priority 0 is the most preferred
path. In the case that the list is empty, any secondary
path option may be utilised when the current primary path
is in use.

candidate-secondary-path.description:
List of secondary paths which may be utilised when the
current primary path is in use

secondary-path.description:
A reference to the secondary path option reference
which acts as the key of the candidate-secondary-path
list

config.description:
Configuration parameters relating to the candidate
secondary path

state.description:
Operational state parameters relating to the candidate
secondary path

p2p-secondary-paths-top.description: Top level grouping for p2p secondary paths

p2p-secondary-path.description: List of p2p primary paths for a tunnel

config.description: Configuration parameters related to paths

state.description: State parameters related to paths

te-tunnels-top.description: Top level grouping for TE tunnels

tunnel.description:
List of TE tunnels. This list contains only the LSPs that the
current device originates (i.e., for which it is the head-end).
Where the signaling protocol utilised for an LSP allows a mid-point
or tail device to be aware of the LSP (e.g., RSVP-TE), then the
associated sessions are maintained per protocol

config.description: Configuration parameters related to TE tunnels:

state.description: State parameters related to TE tunnels

igp-lsp-setup.description: signaling protocol definitions for IGP-based LSPs

path-setup-protocol.description:
select and configure the signaling method for
 the LSP

next-hop.description: next hop IP address for the LSP

incoming-label.description: label value on the incoming packet

push-label.description:
label value to push at the current hop for the
LSP

static-lsp-ingress-state.description: Operational state data for ingress LSPs

static-lsp-ingress-top.description: Top-level grouping for ingress LSP data

ingress.description:
Static LSPs for which the router is an
 ingress node

config.description: Configuration data for ingress LSPs

state.description: Operational state data for ingress LSPs

static-lsp-transit-state.description: Operational state data for transit LSPs

static-lsp-transit-top.description: Top-level grouping for transit LSP data

transit.description:
Static LSPs for which the router is an
 transit node

config.description: Configuration data for transit LSPs

state.description: Operational state data for transit LSPs

static-lsp-egress-state.description: Operational state data for egress LSPs

static-lsp-egress-top.description: Top-level grouping for egress LSP data

egress.description:
Static LSPs for which the router is an
 egress node

config.description: Configuration data for egress LSPs

state.description: Operational state data for egress LSPs

static-lsp-state.description: Operational state data for static LSPs

static-lsp-top.description: grouping for top level list of static LSPs

config.description: Configuration data for the static lsp

state.description: Operational state data for the static lsp

enable.description: Enables soft preemption on a node.

soft-preemption-timeout.description:
Timeout value for soft preemption to revert
to hard preemption. The default timeout for
soft-preemption is 30 seconds - after which
the local system reverts to hard pre-emption.

mpls-rsvp-soft-preemption.description: Top level group for MPLS soft preemption

soft-preemption.description:
Protocol options relating to RSVP
soft preemption

config.description:
Configuration parameters relating to RSVP
soft preemption support

state.description:
State parameters relating to RSVP
soft preemption support

hello-interval.description:
set the interval in ms between RSVP hello
messages

refresh-reduction.description:
enables all RSVP refresh reduction message
bundling, RSVP message ID, reliable message delivery
and summary refresh

mpls-rsvp-hellos.description: Top level grouping for RSVP hellos parameters

hellos.description: Top level container for RSVP hello parameters

config.description:
Configuration parameters relating to RSVP
hellos

state.description: State information associated with RSVP hellos

subscription.description:
percentage of the interface bandwidth that
RSVP can reserve

mpls-rsvp-subscription-state.description:
Operational state parameters relating to the
bandwidth subscription on an interface

calculated-absolute-subscription-bw.description:
The calculated absolute value of the bandwidth
which is reservable to RSVP-TE on the interface
prior to any adjustments that may be made from
external sources.

mpls-rsvp-subscription.description: Top level group for RSVP subscription options

subscription.description:
Bandwidth percentage reservable by RSVP
on an interface

config.description:
Configuration parameters relating to RSVP
subscription options

state.description:
State parameters relating to RSVP
subscription options

mpls-rsvp-graceful-restart-config.description: Configuration parameters relating to RSVP Graceful-Restart

enable.description: Enables graceful restart on the node.

mpls-rsvp-graceful-restart.description:
Top level group for RSVP graceful-restart
parameters

graceful-restart.description:
Operational state and configuration parameters relating to
graceful-restart for RSVP

config.description:
Configuration parameters relating to
graceful-restart

state.description:
State information associated with
RSVP graceful-restart

enable.description: Enables RSVP authentication on the node.

mpls-rsvp-authentication.description:
Top level group for RSVP authentication,
as per RFC2747

authentication.description:
Configuration and state parameters relating to RSVP
authentication as per RFC2747

config.description:
Configuration parameters relating
to authentication

state.description:
State information associated
with authentication

link-protection-style-requested.description:
Style of mpls frr protection desired:
link, link-node, or unprotected

bypass-optimize-interval.description:
interval between periodic optimization
of the bypass LSPs

mpls-rsvp-link-protection.description: Top level group for RSVP protection

config.description: Configuration for link-protection

state.description: State for link-protection

mpls-rsvp-statistics.description: Top level grouping for RSVP protocol state

neighbors.description:
Configuration and state for RSVP neighbors connecting
to the device

neighbor.description: List of RSVP neighbors of the local system

address.description: Reference to the address of the RSVP neighbor

state.description:
Operational state parameters relating to the
RSVP neighbor

global.description: Platform wide RSVP configuration and state

state.description: Platform wide RSVP state, including counters

counters.description: Platform wide RSVP statistics and counters

errors.description:
Error counters associated with the global RSVP-TE
instance.

interface-attributes.description: Attributes relating to RSVP-TE enabled interfaces

config.description: Configuration of per-interface RSVP parameters

state.description: Per-interface RSVP protocol and state information

counters.description: Interface specific RSVP statistics and counters

soft-preemption.description: Enables RSVP soft-preemption on this LSP

rsvp-priorities-tunnel-config.description:
Configuration paramters related to RSVP-TE priorities for
an LSP tunnel

setup-priority.description:
RSVP-TE preemption priority during LSP setup, lower is
higher priority; default 7 indicates that LSP will not
preempt established LSPs during setup

hold-priority.description:
preemption priority once the LSP is established,
lower is higher priority; default 0 indicates other LSPs
will not preempt the LSPs once established

rsvp-priorities-path-config.description:
Configuration paramters related to RSVP-TE priorities on
a primary/secondary path associated with an LSP.

setup-priority.description:
RSVP-TE preemption priority during LSP setup, lower is
higher priority; default 7 indicates that LSP will not
preempt established LSPs during setup

hold-priority.description:
preemption priority once the LSP is established,
lower is higher priority; default 0 indicates other LSPs
will not preempt the LSPs once established

retry-timer.description:
sets the time between attempts to establish the
LSP

detected-interface.description: Interface where RSVP neighbor was detected

neighbor-status.description: Enumuration of possible RSVP neighbor states

refresh-reduction.description: Suppport of neighbor for RSVP refresh reduction

mpls-rsvp-session-state.description: State information for RSVP TE sessions

local-index.description:
Reference to the local index for the RSVP
session

state.description:
Operational state parameters relating to the
RSVP session

local-index.description:
The index used to identify the RSVP session
on the local network element. This index is
generated by the device and is unique only
to the local network element.

tunnel-id.description:
The tunnel ID is an identifier used in the
RSVP session, which remains constant over
the life of the tunnel.

lsp-id.description:
The LSP ID distinguishes between two LSPs
originated from the same headend, and is
commonly used to distinguish RSVP sessions
during make before break operations.

session-name.description: The signaled name of this RSVP session.

type.description:
The type/role of the RSVP session, signifing
the session's role on the current device, such as
a transit session vs. an ingress session.

protection-requested.description: The type of protection requested for the RSVP session

label-in.description: Incoming MPLS label associated with this RSVP session

label-out.description: Outgoing MPLS label associated with this RSVP session

sender-tspec.description:
Operational state statistics relating to the SENDER_TSPEC
received for the RSVP session

rate.description:
The rate at which the head-end device generates traffic,
expressed in bytes per second.

size.description:
The size of the token bucket that is used to determine
the rate at which the head-end device generates traffic,
expressed in bytes per second.

peak-data-rate.description:
The maximum traffic generation rate that the head-end
device sends traffic at.

mpls-rsvp-interfaces-config.description: RSVP configuration information relevant to an interface

mpls-rsvp-interfaces-state.description: RSVP state information relevant to an interface

max-link-bandwidth.description:
The maximum link bandwidth expressed in kilobits
per second. This value should be the same (other than
the units) as the value that is advertised into the
IGP traffic engineering database.

mpls-rsvp-interface-reservations.description:
Operational state related to interface bandwidth
reservations

bandwidth-reservation.description:
Available and reserved bandwidth by priority on
the interface.

priority.description: Reference to the RSVP priority level

state.description:
Operational state parameters relating to a
bandwidth reservation at a certain priority

priority.description: RSVP priority level for LSPs traversing the interface

available-bandwidth.description:
Bandwidth currently available with the priority level,
or for the entire interface when the priority is set to
ALL

reserved-bandwidth.description:
Bandwidth currently reserved within the priority level,
or the sum of all priority levels when the keyword is set
to ALL

active-reservations-count.description:
Number of active RSVP reservations in the associated
priority, or the sum of all reservations when the priority
level is set to ALL

highwater-mark.description:
Maximum bandwidth reserved on the interface within the
priority, or across all priorities in the case that the
priority level is set to ALL

mpls-rsvp-global-protocol-state.description:
RSVP protocol statistics which may not apply
on an interface, but are significant globally.

path-timeouts.description:
The number of Path State Blocks (PSBs) that
have been timed out by the local system.

reservation-timeouts.description:
The number of Reservation State Blocks (RSBs) that
have been timed out by the local system.

mpls-rsvp-rate-limited-messages-state.description: Common grouping for rate limit messages

rate-limited-messages.description: RSVP messages dropped due to rate limiting

mpls-rsvp-protocol-state.description: RSVP protocol statistics and message counters

in-path-messages.description: Number of received RSVP Path messages

in-path-error-messages.description: Number of received RSVP Path Error messages

in-path-tear-messages.description: Number of received RSVP Path Tear messages

in-reservation-messages.description: Number of received RSVP Resv messages

in-reservation-error-messages.description: Number of received RSVP Resv Error messages

in-reservation-tear-messages.description: Number of received RSVP Resv Tear messages

in-hello-messages.description: Number of received RSVP hello messages

in-srefresh-messages.description: Number of received RSVP summary refresh messages

in-ack-messages.description:
Number of received RSVP refresh reduction ack
messages

out-path-messages.description: Number of sent RSVP PATH messages

out-path-error-messages.description: Number of sent RSVP Path Error messages

out-path-tear-messages.description: Number of sent RSVP Path Tear messages

out-reservation-messages.description: Number of sent RSVP Resv messages

out-reservation-error-messages.description: Number of sent RSVP Resv Error messages

out-reservation-tear-messages.description: Number of sent RSVP Resv Tear messages

out-hello-messages.description: Number of sent RSVP hello messages

out-srefresh-messages.description: Number of sent RSVP summary refresh messages

out-ack-messages.description: Number of sent RSVP refresh reduction ack messages

mpls-rsvp-record-route-object-top.description:
Top-level structure grouping for list of record route
objects.

record-route-objects.description:
Enclosing container for MPLS RRO objects associated with the
traffic engineered tunnel.

record-route-object.description:
Read-only list of record route objects associated with the
traffic engineered tunnel. Each entry in the list
may contain a hop IP address, MPLS label allocated
at the hop, and the flags associated with the entry.

index.description:
Reference to the index of the record route object.
The index is used to indicate the ordering of hops in
the path.

state.description:
Information related to RRO objects. The hop, label, and
optional flags are present for each entry in the list.

mpls-rsvp-record-route-object-state.description:
Grouping to hold information relating to record route
objects relevant to a traffic engineering LSP.

index.description: Index of object in the list. Used for ordering.

address.description: IP router hop for RRO entry

explicit-route-objects.description:
Enclosing container for MPLS ERO objects associated
with the traffic engineered tunnel.

explicit-route-object.description:
Read-only list of explicit route objects associated with the
traffic-engineered tunnel. Each entry in the list contains
a hop IP address, and the MPLS label allocated at the hop.

index.description:
Reference to the index of the entry in the explicit route
object. The index is used to indicate the ordering of hops
in the path.

state.description: Information related to the ERO index.

mpls-rsvp-explicit-route-object-state.description:
Grouping defining information related to an individual hop
of an ERO.

index.description:
Index of the entry in the ERO. Entries are ordered in
ascending order from the source to destination of the
LSP.

loose.description:
When set to true, indicates that the hop of the ERO is
a loose hop within the explicit route. If unset, indicates
that the hop must explicitly traverse the entity specified
in the ERO hop as the next-entity.

type.description: The type of hop indicated by the ERO entry.

ip-prefix.description:
The IPv4 or IPv6 prefix indicated by the ERO. Specified
only when the ERO hop is an IPv4 or IPv6 prefix.

asn.description:
The autonomous system number indicated by the ERO. Specified
only when the ERO hop is an 2 or 4-byte AS number.

label.description:
The MPLS label specified in the ERO hop. Specified only when
the hop is an MPLS label.

interface-id.description:
The interface ID for an unnumbered interface. Specified only
when the ERO hop is a unnumbered interface.

mpls-rsvp-error-counters.description:
Grouping containing definitions of leaves relating to
errors in RSVP-TE. This grouping can be used in different
contexts - e.g., per-RSVP-TE protocol instance, or per-
interface such that the errors represented should
correspond to the number of errors that have occurred for
the context in which the grouping is used.

authentication-fail.description:
The number of packets received that have failed RSVP-TE
authentication checks in the specified context.

bad-checksum.description:
The number of packets received that have an incorrect RSVP-TE
checksum in the context.

bad-packet-format.description:
The number of packets received that were dropped due to being
badly formed in the context.

bad-packet-length.description:
The number of packets received that were dropped due to having
an invalid length specified in the context.

out-of-order.description: The number of messages received out of order in the context.

received-nack.description: The number of NACK RESV messages received in the context.

transmit-failure.description: The total number of packets dropped on transmit in the context.

transmit-queue-full.description:
The number of packets dropped due to the transmit queue being
full in the context.

unknown-ack.description:
The number of packets received containing an ACK for an unknown
message ID in the context.

unknown-nack.description:
The number of packets received containing a NACK for an unknown
message ID in the context.

stat-interval-state.description: Reusable leaf definition for stats computation interval

interval.description:
If supported by the system, this reports the time interval
over which the min/max/average statistics are computed by
the system.

min-max-time.description:
Common grouping for recording the absolute time at which
the minimum and maximum values occurred in the statistics

min-time.description:
The absolute time at which the minimum value occurred.
The value is the timestamp in nanoseconds relative to
 the Unix Epoch (Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

max-time.description:
The absolute time at which the maximum value occurred.
The value is the timestamp in nanoseconds relative to
 the Unix Epoch (Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

avg-min-max-stats-precision1.description:
Common nodes for recording average, minimum, and
maximum values for a statistic.  These values all have
fraction-digits set to 1.  Statistics are computed
and reported based on a moving time interval (e.g., the last
30s).  If supported by the device, the time interval over which
the statistics are computed is also reported.

avg.description:
The arithmetic mean value of the statistic over the
time interval.

min.description:
The minimum value of the statistic over the time
interval.

max.description:
The maximum value of the statitic over the time
interval.

avg-min-max-instant-stats-precision1.description:
Common grouping for recording an instantaneous statistic value
in addition to avg-min-max stats

instant.description: The instantaneous value of the statistic.

avg-min-max-instant-stats-precision2-dB.description:
Common grouping for recording dB values with 2 decimal
precision. Values include the instantaneous, average,
minimum, and maximum statistics.  Statistics are computed
and reported based on a moving time interval (e.g., the last
30s).  If supported by the device, the time interval over which
the statistics are computed, and the times at which the minimum
and maximum values occurred, are also reported.

instant.description: The instantaneous value of the statistic.

avg.description:
The arithmetic mean value of the statistic over the
time interval.

min.description: The minimum value of the statistic over the time interval.

max.description:
The maximum value of the statistic over the time
interval.

avg-min-max-instant-stats-precision2-dBm.description:
Common grouping for recording dBm values with 2 decimal
precision. Values include the instantaneous, average,
minimum, and maximum statistics.  Statistics are computed
and reported based on a moving time interval (e.g., the last
30s).  If supported by the device, the time interval over which
the statistics are computed, and the times at which the minimum
and maximum values occurred, are also reported.

instant.description: The instantaneous value of the statistic.

avg.description:
The arithmetic mean value of the statistic over the
time interval.

min.description:
The minimum value of the statistic over the time
interval.

max.description: The maximum value of the statistic over the time interval.

avg-min-max-instant-stats-precision2-mA.description:
Common grouping for recording mA values with 2 decimal
precision. Values include the instantaneous, average,
minimum, and maximum statistics.  Statistics are computed
and reported based on a moving time interval (e.g., the last
30s).  If supported by the device, the time interval over which
the statistics are computed, and the times at which the minimum
and maximum values occurred, are also reported.

instant.description: The instantaneous value of the statistic.

avg.description:
The arithmetic mean value of the statistic over the
time interval.

min.description:
The minimum value of the statistic over the time
interval.

max.description:
The maximum value of the statistic over the time
interval.

avg-min-max-instant-stats-pct.description:
Common grouping for percentage statistics.
Values include the instantaneous, average,
minimum, and maximum statistics.  Statistics are computed
and reported based on a moving time interval (e.g., the last
30s).  If supported by the device, the time interval over which
the statistics are computed, and the times at which the minimum
and maximum values occurred, are also reported.

avg.description:
The arithmetic mean value of the percentage measure of the
statistic over the time interval.

min.description:
The minimum value of the percentage measure of the
statistic over the time interval.

max.description:
The maximum value of the percentage measure of the
statistic over the time interval.

interface.description:
Reference to a base interface.  If a reference to a
subinterface is required, this leaf must be specified
to indicate the base interface.

subinterface.description:
Reference to a subinterface -- this requires the base
interface to be specified using the interface leaf in
this container.  If only a reference to a base interface
is requuired, this leaf should not be set.

interface-ref-state-container.description:
Reusable opstate w/container for a reference to an
interface or subinterface

state.description: Operational state for interface-ref

interface-ref.description:
Reusable definition for a reference to an interface or
subinterface
Reference to an interface or subinterface

config.description: Configured reference to interface / subinterface

interface-ref-state.description:
Reusable opstate w/container for a reference to an
interface or subinterface

interface-ref.description: Reference to an interface or subinterface

base-interface-ref-state.description:
Reusable opstate w/container for a reference to a
base interface (no subinterface).

state.description: Operational state for base interface reference

interface-common-config.description:
Configuration data data nodes common to physical interfaces
and subinterfaces

description.description:
A textual description of the interface.

A server implementation MAY map this leaf to the ifAlias
MIB object.  Such an implementation needs to use some
mechanism to handle the differences in size and characters
allowed between this leaf and ifAlias.  The definition of
such a mechanism is outside the scope of this document.

Since ifAlias is defined to be stored in non-volatile
storage, the MIB implementation MUST map ifAlias to the
value of 'description' in the persistently stored
datastore.

Specifically, if the device supports ':startup', when
ifAlias is read the device MUST return the value of
'description' in the 'startup' datastore, and when it is
written, it MUST be written to the 'running' and 'startup'
datastores.  Note that it is up to the implementation to

decide whether to modify this single leaf in 'startup' or
perform an implicit copy-config from 'running' to
'startup'.

If the device does not support ':startup', ifAlias MUST
be mapped to the 'description' leaf in the 'running'
datastore.

enabled.description:
This leaf contains the configured, desired state of the
interface.

Systems that implement the IF-MIB use the value of this
leaf in the 'running' datastore to set
IF-MIB.ifAdminStatus to 'up' or 'down' after an ifEntry
has been initialized, as described in RFC 2863.

Changes in this leaf in the 'running' datastore are
reflected in ifAdminStatus, but if ifAdminStatus is
changed over SNMP, this leaf is not affected.

name.description:
The name of the interface.

A device MAY restrict the allowed values for this leaf,
possibly depending on the type of the interface.
For system-controlled interfaces, this leaf is the
device-specific name of the interface.  The 'config false'
list interfaces/interface[name]/state contains the currently
existing interfaces on the device.

If a client tries to create configuration for a
system-controlled interface that is not present in the
corresponding state list, the server MAY reject
the request if the implementation does not support
pre-provisioning of interfaces or if the name refers to
an interface that can never exist in the system.  A
NETCONF server MUST reply with an rpc-error with the
error-tag 'invalid-value' in this case.

The IETF model in RFC 7223 provides YANG features for the
following (i.e., pre-provisioning and arbitrary-names),
however they are omitted here:

 If the device supports pre-provisioning of interface
 configuration, the 'pre-provisioning' feature is
 advertised.

 If the device allows arbitrarily named user-controlled
 interfaces, the 'arbitrary-names' feature is advertised.

When a configured user-controlled interface is created by
the system, it is instantiated with the same name in the
/interfaces/interface[name]/state list.

type.description:
The type of the interface.

When an interface entry is created, a server MAY
initialize the type leaf with a valid value, e.g., if it
is possible to derive the type from the name of the
interface.

If a client tries to set the type of an interface to a
value that can never be used by the system, e.g., if the
type is not supported or if the type does not match the
name of the interface, the server MUST reject the request.
A NETCONF server MUST reply with an rpc-error with the
error-tag 'invalid-value' in this case.

mtu.description:
Set the max transmission unit size in octets
for the physical interface.  If this is not set, the mtu is
set to the operational default -- e.g., 1514 bytes on an
Ethernet interface.

loopback-mode.description:
When set to true, the interface is logically looped back,
such that packets that are forwarded via the interface
are received on the same interface.

interface-phys-holdtime-config.description:
Configuration data for interface hold-time settings --
applies to physical interfaces.

up.description:
Dampens advertisement when the interface
transitions from down to up.  A zero value means dampening
is turned off, i.e., immediate notification.

down.description:
Dampens advertisement when the interface transitions from
up to down.  A zero value means dampening is turned off,
i.e., immediate notification.

interface-phys-holdtime-state.description: Operational state data for interface hold-time.

interface-phys-holdtime-top.description:
Top-level grouping for setting link transition
dampening on physical and other types of interfaces.

hold-time.description:
Top-level container for hold-time settings to enable
dampening advertisements of interface transitions.

config.description: Configuration data for interface hold-time settings.

state.description: Operational state data for interface hold-time.

interface-common-state.description:
Operational state data (in addition to intended configuration)
at the global level for this interface

ifindex.description:
System assigned number for each interface.  Corresponds to
ifIndex object in SNMP Interface MIB

admin-status.description:
The desired state of the interface.  In RFC 7223 this leaf
has the same read semantics as ifAdminStatus.  Here, it
reflects the administrative state as set by enabling or
disabling the interface.

oper-status.description:
The current operational state of the interface.

This leaf has the same semantics as ifOperStatus.

last-change.description:
This timestamp indicates the time of the last state change
of the interface (e.g., up-to-down transition). This
corresponds to the ifLastChange object in the standard
interface MIB.

The value is the timestamp in nanoseconds relative to
the Unix Epoch (Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

interface-counters-state.description:
Operational state representing interface counters
and statistics.

counters.description: A collection of interface-related statistics objects.

in-octets.description:
The total number of octets received on the interface,
including framing characters.

Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
at re-initialization of the management system, and at
other times as indicated by the value of
'last-clear'.

in-unicast-pkts.description:
The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a
higher (sub-)layer, that were not addressed to a
multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer.

Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
at re-initialization of the management system, and at
other times as indicated by the value of
'last-clear'.

in-broadcast-pkts.description:
The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a
higher (sub-)layer, that were addressed to a broadcast
address at this sub-layer.

Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
at re-initialization of the management system, and at
other times as indicated by the value of
'last-clear'.

in-multicast-pkts.description:
The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a
higher (sub-)layer, that were addressed to a multicast
address at this sub-layer.  For a MAC-layer protocol,
this includes both Group and Functional addresses.

Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
at re-initialization of the management system, and at
other times as indicated by the value of
'last-clear'.

in-discards.description:
The number of inbound packets that were chosen to be
discarded even though no errors had been detected to
prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer
protocol.  One possible reason for discarding such a
packet could be to free up buffer space.

Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
at re-initialization of the management system, and at
other times as indicated by the value of
'last-clear'.

in-errors.description:
For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound
packets that contained errors preventing them from being
deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.  For character-
oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of
inbound transmission units that contained errors
preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer
protocol.

Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
at re-initialization of the management system, and at
other times as indicated by the value of
'last-clear'.

in-unknown-protos.description:
For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of packets
received via the interface that were discarded because
of an unknown or unsupported protocol.  For
character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces that
support protocol multiplexing, the number of
transmission units received via the interface that were
discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.
For any interface that does not support protocol
multiplexing, this counter is not present.

Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
at re-initialization of the management system, and at
other times as indicated by the value of
'last-clear'.

in-fcs-errors.description:
Number of received packets which had errors in the
frame check sequence (FCS), i.e., framing errors.

Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
when the device is re-initialization as indicated by the
value of 'last-clear'.

out-octets.description:
The total number of octets transmitted out of the
interface, including framing characters.

Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
at re-initialization of the management system, and at
other times as indicated by the value of
'last-clear'.

out-unicast-pkts.description:
The total number of packets that higher-level protocols
requested be transmitted, and that were not addressed
to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer,
including those that were discarded or not sent.

Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
at re-initialization of the management system, and at
other times as indicated by the value of
'last-clear'.

out-broadcast-pkts.description:
The total number of packets that higher-level protocols
requested be transmitted, and that were addressed to a
broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those
that were discarded or not sent.

Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
at re-initialization of the management system, and at
other times as indicated by the value of
'last-clear'.

out-multicast-pkts.description:
The total number of packets that higher-level protocols
requested be transmitted, and that were addressed to a
multicast address at this sub-layer, including those
that were discarded or not sent.  For a MAC-layer
protocol, this includes both Group and Functional
addresses.

Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
at re-initialization of the management system, and at
other times as indicated by the value of
'last-clear'.

out-discards.description:
The number of outbound packets that were chosen to be
discarded even though no errors had been detected to
prevent their being transmitted.  One possible reason
for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer
space.

Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
at re-initialization of the management system, and at
other times as indicated by the value of
'last-clear'.

out-errors.description:
For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound
packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.
For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the
number of outbound transmission units that could not be
transmitted because of errors.

Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur
at re-initialization of the management system, and at
other times as indicated by the value of
'last-clear'.

carrier-transitions.description:
Number of times the interface state has transitioned
between up and down since the time the device restarted
or the last-clear time, whichever is most recent.

last-clear.description:
Timestamp of the last time the interface counters were
cleared.

The value is the timestamp in nanoseconds relative to
the Unix Epoch (Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

enabled.description:
Indicates that the subinterface is unnumbered.  By default
the subinterface is numbered, i.e., expected to have an
IP address configuration.

unnumbered.description:
Top-level container for setting unnumbered interfaces.
Includes reference the interface that provides the
address information

config.description: Configuration data for unnumbered interface

state.description: Operational state data for unnumbered interfaces

index.description:
The index of the subinterface, or logical interface number.
On systems with no support for subinterfaces, or not using
subinterfaces, this value should default to 0, i.e., the
default subinterface.

name.description:
The system-assigned name for the sub-interface.  This MAY
be a combination of the base interface name and the
subinterface index, or some other convention used by the
system.

subinterfaces-top.description:
Subinterface data for logical interfaces associated with a
given interface

subinterfaces.description:
Enclosing container for the list of subinterfaces associated
with a physical interface

subinterface.description:
The list of subinterfaces (logical interfaces) associated
with a physical interface

index.description:
The index number of the subinterface -- used to address
the logical interface

config.description: Configurable items at the subinterface level

state.description: Operational state data for logical interfaces

interfaces-top.description:
Top-level grouping for interface configuration and
operational state data

interfaces.description:
Top level container for interfaces, including configuration
and state data.

interface.description: The list of named interfaces on the device.

name.description: References the configured name of the interface

config.description:
Configurable items at the global, physical interface
level

state.description: Operational state data at the global interface level

global.description: Platform wide LDP configuration and state

config.description: Configuration of LDP authentication attributes

state.description: LDP authentication state.

neighbors.description: State and configuration LDP neighbors attributes

neighbor.description: List of LDP neighbors and their attributes.

label-space-id.description: Label space ID of the neighbor.

config.description: Neighbor configuration attributes.

state.description: Neighbor state attributes.

hello-adjacencies.description:
Top container for hello adjacencies
for a given LDP neighbor.

hello-adjacency.description:
List of hello adjacencies for a given LDP
neighbor.

remote-address.description:
Within the LDP adjacency, this attribute
shows the neighbor address.

local-address.description:
Within the LDP adjacency, this attribute
shows the local address.

state.description:
State information for a particular LDP
hello adjacency.

hello-holdtime.description:
Specifies the time the sending LSR will
maintain its record of Hellos from the
receiving LSR

state.description:
State attributes related to the
hello-holdtime.

label-space-id.description: Label space ID of the neighbor.

mpls-ldp-adjacency-state.description: Set of LDP neighbor related state attributes.

remote-address.description:
Within the LDP adjacency, this attribute
shows the neighbor address.

local-address.description:
Within the LDP adjacency, this attribute
shows the local address.

adjacency-type.description:
This attributes defines if the LDP
adjacency is from a direct link or from
targeted discovery.

last-clear.description:
Timestamp of the last time the interface counters
were cleared expressed relative to the Unix Epoch
(January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

hello-received.description: Number of Hello messaged received by the device

hello-dropped.description: Number of Hello messaged dropped by the device

mpls-ldp-hello-holdtime-state.description:
Grouping containing the state attributes
for hello holdtime.

adjacent.description:
Hello holdtime attribute learned from the
LDP neighbor

negotiated.description:
Hello holdtime attribute negotiated between
the LDP neighbor and the local router.

hello-expiration.description: Expiration time for the hello holdtime.

next-hello.description:
Time when the next LDP hello will be sent to
the adjacent neighbor.

config.description: Global LDP configuration attributes.

state.description: Global LDP state information.

mpls-ldp-global-config.description: Grouping containing platform wide LDP information

lsr-id.description:
Global label switch router identifier
configuration.

mpls-ldp-interface-attributes-top.description:
Top-level structure grouping for interface
attributes

interface-attributes.description:
Container including attributes for LDP-enabled
interfaces

config.description: Configuration of per-interface LDP parameters

state.description: Per-interface LDP protocol and state information

interfaces.description:
Container aggregating all interfaces and their
LDP-specific attributes.

config.description: Configuration of per-interface LDP parameters

state.description: Per-interface LDP protocol and state information

counters.description: Interface specific LDP statistics and counters

mpls-ldp-address-families-ldp-top.description:
Grouping containing the state and configuration
attributes for adress families.

address-families.description:
Top container comprising the adress families
attributes

address-family.description: List for attributes related to address-families for LDP.

config.description:
Configuration attributes related to address-families
for LDP.

state.description: State attributes related to address-families for LDP.

mpls-ldp-hello-timers-top-config.description:
Grouping containing interface-related attributes
that can be configured for LDP.

hello-holdtime.description:
Defines the time for which a neighbor adjacency will
be kept by the router while it waits for a new link
Hello message.

hello-interval.description:
Defines the interval for sending Hello messages on
each link LDP adjacency.

mpls-ldp-targeted-top.description: Grouping containing attributes for targeted LDP

targeted.description:
Top container for targeted LDP state and configuration
attributes.

config.description: Configuration attributes related to targeted LDP.

state.description: State attributes related to targeted LDP.

mpls-ldp-address-targeted-ldp-top.description: Grouping containing address attributes for targeted LDP.

address-families.description: Global container for IPv4 and IPv6 attributes for LDP.

address-family.description:
List of address families for targeted LDP
configuration

config.description: Address-family configuration for targeted LDP

state.description: Address-family state for targeted LDP

targets.description:
Container aggregating all targeted sessions and
their LDP-specific attributes.

remote-address.description: Neighbor address of the targeted LDP session

config.description:
Configuration parameters of a targeted LDP
adjacency

remote-address.description:
Configuration of neighbor address of the
targeted LDP adjacency

local-address.description: Local IP address of the LDP adjacency

state.description: State attributes of a targeted LDP adjacency

remote-address.description: Neighbor address of the targeted LDP adjacency

local-address.description: Local IP address of the LDP adjacency

mpls-ldp-targeted-attributes-top-config.description:
Grouping containing targeted LDP configuration
attributes.

hello-accept.description:
Enables or disables the acceptance of targeted LDP
hello messages.

mpls-ldp-interfaces-config.description: LDP configuration information relevant to an interface

graceful-restart.description: Top container for LDP graceful-restart attributes

config.description: LDP graceful-restart configuration attributes.

state.description: LDP graceful-restart state attributes.

mpls-ldp-graceful-restart-config.description: Configuration parameters relating to LDP Graceful-Restart

reconnect-time.description:
Interval for which the remote LDP peers
will wait for the local node to reconnect after a
failure

recovery-time.description:
Interval used to specify the time for the remote
peer to maintain the MPLS forwarding state after
the local node has succesfully reconnected

forwarding-holdtime.description:
Time that defines the interval for keeping the
node in recovery mode.

helper-enable.description: Enables the graceful restart helper for LDP.

igp-tunnel-ldp.description:
common defintiions for LDP-signaled LSP tunnel
types

ldp.description: LDP signaling setup for IGP-congruent LSPs

enable.description: Enables LDP authentication on the node.

admin-config.description: Re-usable grouping to enable or disable a particular LDP feature.

enabled.description:
When set to true, the functionality within which this leaf is
defined is enabled, when set to false it is explicitly disabled.

srgb-config.description: Configuration parameters relating to the SRGB.

local-id.description:
Unique identifier for the segment routing global block on
the local system.

dataplane-type.description:
The dataplane being used to instantiate the SRGB. When MPLS is specified
the set of MPLS label blocks that are defined in the mpls-label-blocks
list are used to make up the SRGB. When IPv6 is specified, the set of IPv6
prefixes specified in the ipv6-prefixes list are used.

items.description:
A list of refences to the label blocks that are used to make
up the SRGB.

A list of IPv6 prefixes which are to be used for segment routing using
the IPv6 dataplane.

srgb-state.description: Operational state parameters relating to the SRGB.

size.description: The total number of SRGB entries that are available within the SRGB.

used.description:
The total number of SRGB entries that have already been alocated by
protocols referencing the SRGB.

srlb-config.description: Configuration parameters relating to an SRLB.

local-id.description:
A unique local identifier used for the Segment Routing Local Block.
The identifier is used when referencing the SRLB within other
contexts.

dataplane-type.description:
The dataplane that is to be used for the Segment Routing Local Block.
When MPLS is specified, the local block corresponds to a block of MPLS
labels; when IPv6 is specified it corresponds to an IPv6 prefix.

mpls-label-block.description:
A reference to the MPLS label block that is used to contain the
SIDs of the SRLB.

ipv6-prefix.description: The IPv6 prefix that is used for the SRLB.

sr-structural.description: Top-level structural grouping defining Segment Routing Global Blocks.

srgbs.description:
Configuration and operational state parameters relating to the
SRGBs defined for the system.

srgb.description:
A single definition of an SRGB which may comprise of multiple
sets of dataplane addresses (IPv6 addresses, or MPLS labels).

local-id.description: A reference to the identifier for the SRGB.

config.description: Configuration parameters relating to the SRGB.

state.description: State parameters relating to the SRGB.

srlbs.description:
Configuration and operational state parameters relating to the
Segment Routing Local Blocks (SRLBs) defined for the system.

srlb.description:
A definition of a Segment Routing Local Block, defined to be
a set of Segment Identifiers (specified as MPLS labels or
IPv6 addreses) that are defined for local allocation by the
system. A block may optionally be advertised into an IGP.

local-id.description: Reference to the local identifier used for the SRLB.

config.description: Configuration parameters relating to the SRLB.

state.description: Operational state parmeters relating to the SRLB.

sr-mpls-top.description: Structural grouping defining SR definition within MPLS.

segment-routing.description:
MPLS-specific Segment Routing configuration and operational state
parameters

aggregate-sid-counters.description: Per-SID counters aggregated across all interfaces on the local system

aggregate-sid-counter.description:
Counters aggregated across all of the interfaces of the local
system corresponding to traffic received or forwarded with a
particular SID

mpls-label.description: The MPLS label representing the segment identifier

state.description: State parameters for per-SID statistics

interface.description:
Parameters and MPLS-specific configuration relating to Segment
Routing on an interface.

interface-id.description:
A reference to the ID for the interface for which SR is
configured

config.description:
MPLS-specific Segment Routing configuration parameters
related to an interface.

state.description:
MPLS-specific Segment Routing operational state parameters
related to an interface.

sid-counter.description: Per segment identifier counters for the MPLS dataplane.

mpls-label.description: The MPLS label representing the segment identifier

state.description: State parameters for per-SID statistics

forwarding-classes.description: Per-SID per-forwarding class counters for Segment Routing.

forwarding-class.description:
SID entries for the forwarding class associated with the
referenced MPLS EXP.

exp.description:
Reference to the value of the EXP bits of the segment
identifier.

state.description:
Per-SID, per forwarding class counters for Segment Routing
with the MPLS dataplane

sr-mpls-interface-config.description: MPLS-specific Segment Routing configuration for an interface

interface-id.description: A unique identifier for the interface.

sr-mpls-interface-state.description:
MPLS-specific Segment Routing operational state parameters for an
interface

sr-mpls-interface-sid-fc-state.description: Per-SID per forwarding class statistics for SR with the MPLS dataplane

exp.description:
The value of the MPLS EXP (experimental) or Traffic Class bits that the
SID statistics relate to. Packets received with a MPLS label value
equal to the SID's MPLS label and EXP bits equal to the this value
should be counted towards the associated ingress statistics. Packets
that are forwarded to the destination MPLS label corresponding to the
SID should be counted towards this value. In the egress direction, where
forwarding follows a SID value that requires PHP at the local node,
packets should still be counted towards the egress counters.

mpls-label.description: The MPLS label used for the segment identifier

sr-mpls-common-counters.description: Per segment identifier counters used in the model

in-pkts.description:
A cumulative counter of the packets received within the context
which have matched a label corresponding to an SR Segment Identifier.

in-octets.description:
The cumulative counter of the total bytes received within the context
which have matched a label corresponding to an SR Segment Identifier

out-pkts.description:
A cumulative counter of the total number of packets transmitted by
the local system within the context which have a label imposed that
corresponds to an Segment Identifier.

out-octets.description:
A cumulative counter of the total bytes transmitted by the local
system within the context which have a label imported that
corresponds to an SR Segment Identifier.

sr-igp-config.description:
Configuration parameters relating to segment routing within an
IGP.

enabled.description:
When this leaf is set to true, the segment routing extensions are
utilised within the IGP.

srgb.description:
A reference to the Segment Routing Global Block (SRGB) that is
to be used by this IGP instance.

srlb.description:
A reference to the Segment Routing Local Block (SRLB) that is to
be advertised by the IGP instance.

sr-igp-top.description:
Per-instance configuration and state parameters for Segment Routing
in an IGP.

segment-routing.description: Configuration and operational state relating to segment routing.

config.description:
Configuration parameters relating to the configuration of segment
routing for the IGP instance.

state.description:
Operational state parameters relating to segment routing for the
IGP instance.

sr-igp-interface-prefix-sid-config.description: Configuration parameters relating to an IGP prefix SID advertisement

prefix.description:
The IP prefix for which the IGP prefix SID should be advertised. The
value specified is a local prefix on the interface which is advertised
into the IGP.

sid-id.description: The Segment Identifier to be used when advertising the IGP Prefix SID.

label-options.description:
The options associated with the IGP prefix SID for MPLS. The value
of this leaf specifies the option that the SID should be advertised
into the IGP with.

sr-igp-interface-adjsid-config.description: Configuration parameters relating to an Adj-SID on an interface

sid-id.description:
The value of the Adj-SID to be advertised. Where a static SID
identifier is specified, this should be advertised directly by the
system. Where the DYNAMIC value is specified, this should be treated
as a dynamically allocated value. When the MPLS data plane is in use
the dynamic value should not fall within a reserved-label-block.

protection-eligible.description:
Whether the Adj-SID should be considered to be eligible for protection
using IP or MPLS FRR during a network failure. When this value is set to
true, the B-flag of the Adj-SID is set to 1, and the local system should
provide FRR paths for the associated label forwarding entry. When it is
set to false, the local system must not provide FRR for the specified
LFIB entry.

group.description:
When set to true, the Adj-SID is indicated to be part of a group, and
the G flag is set to 1 in the corresponding advertisement in the IGP.

neighbor.description:
The remote system on the interface with which the Adj-SID is
associated.

sr-igp-interface-adjsid-state.description:
Operational state parameters relating to the adjacency SID for an
interface

allocated-dynamic-local.description:
Where an Adjacency SID with a dynamic value is to be allocated by
the system, this leaf reports to the value of the Adj-SID allocated
to this interface.

sr-igp-interface-top.description:
Per-interface configuration and operational state relating to an
interface within the IGP.

segment-routing.description:
Configuration and operatioanl state parameters relating to segment
routing for an interface within the IGP.

prefix-sids.description:
Configuration and operational state parameters relating to
the advertisement of a segment routing IGP-Prefix SID for this
interface.

prefix-sid.description:
An IGP prefix that should have a segment routing IGP-Prefix SID
allocated to it. The value of the SID is specified by the SID ID,
as an absolute value. If the absolute value falls within the SRGB,
the Global flag should be advertised by the system.

prefix.description:
Reference to the prefix for which the IGP-Prefix SID is to be
advertised

config.description: Configuration parameters for the IGP Prefix SID.

state.description: Operational state parameters for the IGP-Prefix SID.

adjacency-sids.description:
Configuration and operational state parameters relating to
the advertisement of a segment routing adjacency SID for this
interface.

adjacency-sid.description:
An Adjacency SID to be advertised for the specified interface.
The Adj-SID's identifier (the SID ID) must be unique, with flags
specified indicating the parameters that should be set for the SID.
Where a SID value is specified that is allocated from the SRGB, the
global flag must be set by the system.

sid-id.description:
Reference to the segment identifier to be used by the local
system.

neighbor.description:
Reference to the neighbor with which the Adjacency SID is
associated.

config.description: Configuraton parameters relating to the AdjSID.

state.description: Operational state parameters relating to the AdjSID.

sr-top.description: Top level grouping for Segment Routing

segment-routing.description:
Configuration and operational state parameters relating to
segment routing.
